description:
Convert ZPL files to PDF with multi-language support and daemon mode

ZPL2PDF is a powerful, cross-platform command-line tool that converts ZPL (Zebra Programming Language) files to high-quality PDF documents.

Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Dual Operation Modes - Conversion mode for individual files and daemon mode for automatic folder monitoring
‚Ä¢ Multi-language Support - 8 languages (EN, PT, ES, FR, DE, IT, JA, ZH)
‚Ä¢ Intelligent Dimension Handling - Automatic extraction from ZPL commands (^PW, ^LL)
‚Ä¢ Cross-Platform - Native support for Windows, Linux, and macOS
‚Ä¢ Clean Architecture - Built with SOLID principles and 90%+ test coverage
‚Ä¢ High Performance - Async processing with retry mechanisms
‚Ä¢ Docker Support - Optimized Alpine Linux image (470MB)

Perfect for:
‚Ä¢ Label printing workflows
‚Ä¢ Automated document generation
‚Ä¢ Enterprise label management systems
‚Ä¢ ERP integration
‚Ä¢ Batch processing
What's New in v2.0.1:

üêõ Bug Fixes

Docker/Linux CLI Mode:
‚Ä¢ Fixed font rendering issues in Alpine Linux Docker images
‚Ä¢ Added fontconfig, ttf-dejavu, ttf-liberation, and font-noto packages
‚Ä¢ Resolved "asset null" errors when running in CLI mode (non-daemon)

ZPL ^FN Tag Rendering:
‚Ä¢ Fixed issue where text fields using ^FN (Field Number) followed by ^FD (Field Data) were not rendered
‚Ä¢ Added ZPL preprocessing to handle unsupported ^FN commands
‚Ä¢ ^FD content is now correctly displayed in generated PDFs

For detailed changes, see: https://github.com/brunoleocam/ZPL2PDF/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md
